info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 7:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Nusiance flooding caused by high flows along the Rocky River. * WHERE...Cabarrus County, North Carolina * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, greenways, parks, boat-access areas, golf courses, low-water crossings, and low-lying roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 PM EDT, The Rocky River remains above Action/Advisory Stage following rounds of heavy rainfall from Monday night and Tuesday. This is causing nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying areas, primarily woodland and farmland between Pharr Mill and Georgeville. The following streamgauge is above Action/Advisory Stage, resulting in nuisance flooding along Rocky River... ID: IRBN7 NAME: above Irish Buffalo Creek, 5 mi W of Georgeville CURRENT STAGE: 14.15 feet CREST: 15.24 feet on June 21 at 12:30 AM TREND: Falling Slowly ESTIMATED FORECAST: The Rocky River is beginning to fall slowly just above 14 feet and will continue to recede through the overnight hours. The river is expected to fall below Action/Advisory Stage tomorrow morning. Additional heavy rainfall is possible on Thursday. This may cause new rises along Rocky River and flooding may redevelop. IMPACTS: Rocky River is flooding primarily adjacent low-lying areas including farmland and woodland. Nuisance flooding at Pharr Mill Park is also likely. Backwater effects may be impacting Pharr Mill Rd. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Harrisburg and Mt Pleasant.
info.instruction: Please continue to heed remaining road closures as some road surfaces may have been compromised by earlier high flows and flooding.
